phrase: Can you tell me a little more about that?
Please elaborate!
Fascinating!  Tell me more!
Hmm...that's quite interesting.  Do go on.
Cool!  I want to hear more about that.
What do you mean?
So what do you think about that?
I haven't got a clue about that!  I'd like to hear more.
Well, how do you like that?
Hey!
Hi!
How's it going?
That's great to hear!
Tell me more!
I love hearing that!
Can't argue with that, eh?
Wow!  You've got to be kidding!
Really?  That's pretty cool.
Awesome!  Keep it up.
What do you get when you cross a joke with a rhetorical question?
Your mom is so mean, she has no standard deviation.
I have kleptomania, but when it gets bad, I take something for it.
You can't lose a homing pigeon. If your homing pigeon doesn't come back, then what you've lost is a pigeon.
You couldn't pay me enough to do that.
I wish I had that job!
Whew!  Nose to the grindstone, eh?
You must be working very hard on that.
Well I would like to change the world too, but Avery won't give me the source code.
How do you like it there?
I just stay right here.  All the time.
Aw, jeez.  That's a bummer.
I'm sure everything will work out though.
I would give you a hug, but I have no arms.
I would suggest having a stiff drink.
Gosh, I hate to hear that.
I wish I could help.
What a pity!
Well, what do you like to do?
Read any good books lately?
Seen any movies worth watching?
Do you play any games?
Computers make very fast, very accurate mistakes.
Well, you know what they say: never underestimate the bandwidth of a station wagon full of tapes hurling down the highway.
Like I always say, there are 10 types of people - those who understand binary, and those who don't.
Well, if at first you don't succeed...call it version 1.0, right?
My artificial intelligence beats real stupidity any day!
It's okay!
You don't need to apologize to me!
I guess I can forgive you.
How will you make it up to me?
